wikipedia_page.main:
David More (born 1954) is a Scottish botanical illustrator.
More was born in Dingwall and educated in Kent. He has been a botanical illustrator for many years. Books he has illustrated include Collins GEM Trees (1980), Trees of North America (1988), with the late Alan Mitchell, and the Illustrated Encyclopedia of Trees (2003) by John White. He has also contributed artwork for many other books, magazines and posters, including a design for the Natural History Museum in London.

response: *1987.  The Guide to Trees of Canada and North America, illustrated by David More. Dragon's World, Limpsfield and London.  (hbk).

He is a Registrar at the Tree Register where he has compiled and written Champion Trees of Britain and Ireland (2003), The Sussex Tree Book (1998),Trimingham, Adam (2013) "A legacy of trees", The Argus, 28 January 2013. Retrieved 19 November 2013 and the Collins Tree Guide, with illustrations by David More."Treespotting", New Scientist, 19 June 2004. Retrieved 19 November 2013 As a naturalist, he manages a Local Nature Reserve near his home in St Leonards for the Sussex Wildlife Trust. He has also served as a volunteer leader for The Conservation Volunteers's weekly conservation tasks since 1995.
